intro: Arnebia tubata, commonly known as the red sanders, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a succulent, tuberous root system that helps it survive in dry conditions.
